meanings.definition: To cool (a liquid) below its freezing point without solidification.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally undercool the soup, so it remained liquid even in the freezer.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to undercool the chocolate, or it won't harden properly.
meanings.sent3: I always seem to undercool my drinks, making them too cold to enjoy!
meanings.sent4: Her icy glare seemed to undercool the room, freezing everyone in place.
meanings.sent5: The undercooling process in the lab was fascinating to watch, as the liquid defied freezing.

meanings.sent1: The lukewarm tea was undercool and unappetizing.
meanings.sent2: She felt undercool in her thin jacket on the chilly night.
meanings.sent3: The undercool air conditioner made the room uncomfortably warm.
meanings.sent4: His undercool response to the exciting news dampened the mood.
meanings.sent5: The undercool breeze sent shivers down her spine on the summer day.
